title: Photovoltaics: What should be considered in electrical installation when modifying the existing electrical system?
answer: Once an existing electrical system is interfered with, such as by a PV installation, the entire system must comply with the current state of technology to obtain the test protocol. This may mean that additional services are required.

title: Monitoring - How Can I Save Money or Energy Through the BE.SpareFlo App?
answer: The BE.SpareFlo app allows you to better understand your electricity consumption on a daily and monthly basis by displaying and visually explaining the energy flows occurring in your household in near real-time. BE.SpareFlo helps you to understand your energy consumption even better. You can also find out if you are using too many devices at the same time, if you should have left a technical device switched on when leaving your apartment or house, or if you should reduce the consumption of permanently switched-on devices (standby). Additionally, you can identify your consumption peaks and estimate the best time for doing laundry, washing dishes, etc.

title: Storage - When is the payment for the storage made to Zholar?
answer: For an immediate purchase, 50% of the purchase price is to be paid before the storage installation and 50% after the completion of the installation and handover of the operational storage. For a credit purchase, you have to make a down payment to zholar for the storage variant you have chosen before the installation of the storage. The remaining amount is paid directly to zholar by the financing bank (Deutsche Bank AG) after the installation and handover of the operational system, and from this point on, you pay the agreed installments to the bank. The invoicing is usually done together with the PV package. For details, see the product sheet Storage.

title: Monitoring - Can I Use the App Without the Energy Monitoring Sensor, a PV System, or a Battery Storage?

The zholar inverter and the Energy Monitoring Sensor are essential for the collection and analysis (using algorithms) of the electricity flows occurring in the household and thus for the main functions of the application. title: Balcony Power Plant - When Will My SolMate Pay Off?
answer: This naturally depends on consumption and electricity prices! With SolMate and four connected panels, you save approximately 1200 kWh per year. At 50 cents per kWh (energy price including taxes, levies, and grid charges), that would be a savings of 600 € per year, or in other words: the payback period in this case is 5-6 years. In addition, SolMate provides an integrated emergency power supply, so the device pays for itself twice over in the event of a longer power outage.

title: Photovoltaics - How long does it take for the network operator to process the grid access application?
answer: The network operators have a legal deadline of four weeks for this. However, from zholar's experience with thousands of network applications, we know that this can sometimes take significantly longer and in individual cases even several months. Of course, zholar stays on the ball to reduce the processing time for our customers as much as possible. It is pleasing that the processing times are currently improving significantly.

title: Photovoltaics: What are the payment terms for the immediate purchase of PV?
answer: For an immediate purchase, 50% of the purchase price is to be paid before the storage installation and 50% after the completion of the installation and handover of the operational storage. For a credit purchase, you have to make a down payment to zholar for the storage variant you have chosen before the storage installation. The remaining amount is paid directly to zholar by the financing bank (Deutsche Bank AG) after the installation and handover of the operational system, and from this point on, you pay the agreed installments to the bank. The invoicing is usually done together with the PV package. For details, see the product sheet Storage.

title: Wallbox - What is a Wallbox?
answer: A Wallbox is a charging station for electric vehicles, typically mounted on a wall, that allows for a safe and fast charging of the vehicle. In our case, it is a "smart" Wallbox that, as a key additional feature, also allows for "PV surplus charging", thus controlling the charging of the electric car in such a way that, if desired, only the unused solar power from one's own PV system is used to charge the car.

title: Photovoltaics - What additional services in the field of electrical installation might be necessary? Who provides these?
answer: The establishment of a photovoltaic (PV) system is considered a significant modification/expansion of an existing electrical system under Austrian law. As soon as an existing electrical system is altered, for example, by a PV installation, the entire system must comply with the current state of technology to obtain the test protocol. It is possible that your electrical system may require additional services to achieve this necessary current state of technology for a positive test protocol and commissioning of the PV system. Such additional services are not covered by the zholar scope of services. title: I Hesitate Because I Need On-Site Consultation for PV Systems: Fast, Efficient, and Online at Zholar
answer: We at Zholar are convinced that the energy transition and the urgently needed expansion of photovoltaics can only succeed if we take new paths. This means that instead of making our customers wait forever for tradesman offers or appointments, which is more the rule than the exception in the current times, we carry out this process online and aim to simplify and speed up the path to a PV system for our customers as much as possible. The information and photos provided in the planning process are thoroughly checked by our planning team. title: Is this the right solar panel system for me? I'm not sure: Recommendations and Sizing
answer: Basic rule - you can never go wrong with a PV system. But indeed, it is important to us to build well-dimensioned systems, hence our recommendations in advertising and in the FAQs. Principle: the size of the PV system should match the consumption. If you are considering acquiring a heat pump or an electric car in the medium term, have sufficient space on the roof, and have the capital available, the next larger system is a forward-looking solution. Keep in mind, a PV system has a lifespan of 20 years and more. Extensions are always possible afterwards.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Can I Use the Zholar SolMate Exclusively in Island Operation?
answer: Yes, in principle, this is possible. Please note: If you use SolMate in island mode and still consume the generated electricity every day and empty the storage, then that's fine. However, if you continuously have your storage in island mode with connected solar panels, the battery is permanently charged to the maximum, which can lead to battery degradation.

title: Photovoltaics - How Exactly Does Credit Purchase Work?
answer: After completing the zholar order and passing the expert check, you will receive a link via email to apply for your financing directly with our financing partner, UniCredit Bank Austria. This can be done online, or if preferred, you can visit a bank branch. After successful completion of the financing, the bank will inform zholar and the order processing (application for network access, etc.) by zholar will begin. The down payment to be made before the PV installation is to be paid directly to zholar, and the further payments to zholar in connection with your PV system will be made directly by the bank. From the installation of your PV system, you will pay the agreed installments to the bank.

title: Monitoring - How is the Energy Monitoring Sensor Installed?
answer: The three-phase energy monitoring sensor can be easily installed in your fuse box without major interruptions to the power supply. The current transformer is placed around the phase cable and the voltage sensors are magnetically attached to the appropriate connections of the circuit breaker. Alternatively, hard wiring is also possible. The inconspicuous sensor fits into most fuse boxes and is installed and activated for you by a zholar partner.

title: Photovoltaics - Can I Cancel the Order?
answer: Yes. You can cancel your order at any time, even up to 14 days after installation, without giving any reason. Such a cancellation is free of charge for you, provided it is made immediately before the start of installation. However, if you declare the cancellation only after the installation, please note that in this case you will have to bear the costs of assembly and disassembly, a loss in value of the PV system, and possibly the costs of additional services. For a more detailed description, please read the purchase contract or the terms and conditions.

title: Photovoltaics - Am I independent of the power grid during a blackout?
answer: No. The photovoltaic system is grid-tied and does not operate independently from the power grid. However, we have already prepared for the future, as the inverter used by zholar is suitable for the use of a battery storage and a grid disconnection (blackout box). See FAQ on the Sissi storage or our Blackout Box for more details on this topic.

title: Photovoltaics - What to Consider for Flat Roofs?
answer: To secure PV systems on flat roofs against shifting and lifting, they must be ballasted. The ballasting plan required for flat roof mounting of the module substructure (based on regional wind and snow loads in combination with roof height, roof area, etc.) is part of the zholar service scope. The cost of the stones used as the appropriate ballast for your flat roof PV system is not covered by the zholar PV package and will be charged to you directly by the zholar installation partner. title: Balcony Power Plant - How Does Island Operation Work?
answer: In island mode, power can be drawn from the SolMate via the socket. A maximum of one Class I device (device with metal housing) may be plugged into the socket, but several Class II devices may be connected simultaneously. SolMate can supply devices up to 1000 watts (2000 watts startup power for 0.5 seconds) in island mode. The SolMate generates a pure sine wave power signal, which means that most consumers can be operated without any problems.

title: Photovoltaics: What is the minimum roof area required for installation?
answer: For a 3 kWp system, approximately 16 m2 is needed on a continuous roof side. A 5 kWp system requires a total of about 26 m2, and an 8 kWp system requires a total of about 42 m2.

title: Storage for Solar Power: Should I Take It or Retrofit It?
answer: The storage allows you to use even more of your own solar power directly - on the one hand, it's a great feeling to cook with solar power in the evening, and on the other hand, it makes you more independent from the energy market and its unpredictable prices. However, if you're unsure or don't want to invest the capital right away, it can also be retrofitted at any time without much effort. We at Zholar are happy to offer this service as well.

title: Storage - What is the Right Storage Size?
answer: Basically, the correct size of the storage depends on your power consumption and the size of your PV system. In an average case, for our PV systems zholarMax (approx. 3 kWp) and zholarMarry (approx. 5 kWh), a ZholarSissi storage with 5 kWh is a good choice. If you have a slightly higher consumption, especially during the night hours, or if the larger PV system zholarMarry XL (approx. 8 kWp) or Zholar Marie XXL (approx. 10 kWp) is installed, you can further increase your independence from the public grid by using the storage with 10 kWh capacity or 15 kWh capacity.

title: Smart Wallbox Price, Costs, Photovoltaics
answer: The smart Wallbox, perfectly suited to your zholar photovoltaic system, comes fully installed. With a charging power of up to 11 kW (technically up to 22 kW), the zholar Wallbox offers fast and reliable charging, so you can spend less time waiting and more time driving. title: Balcony Power Plant - How Long Can the Electricity Be Stored?
answer: The storage unit has a capacity of 1.44 kWh and the energy stays in the storage until you use it, storage losses are minimal. So, if you were to actually not consume any power, the battery would remain fully charged for many days to weeks if the storage is turned off. If the storage is turned on and no new energy is coming from the sun, your SolMate will remain active for 1-2 weeks and then finally be empty. Basically, the storage is intended as a buffer - during the day (when the sun is shining) it is filled with excess energy and at night this stored electricity is consumed.

title: Monitoring - Are there any future features or updates planned for the app?
answer: Yes, the app and the underlying algorithms are continuously improved and optimized. In the future, expansions and updates are planned to integrate additional APIs, such as electric vehicle charging solutions. This will allow information and features from various manufacturers to be bundled into a central all-in-one application, eliminating the need for additional manufacturer-specific applications. The goal is to create a manufacturer-independent, central application that allows a collective display and control of all energy flows. Future functions and updates for the app include the following roadmap: Energy Insights: Direct insight into energy consumption at the device level to better understand energy use and identify potential cost savings. Reports: Weekly and monthly energy reports in-app and via newsletter (available from summer 2023). Energy saving tips: General energy saving tips

title: Monitoring - Why aren't my production data from my PV system or battery storage displayed in real time?

title: Balcony Power Plant - Does SolMate Only Supply Devices on One Power Phase?
answer: SolMate physically feeds into only one phase and also only measures this one phase. However, the balancing is done across all three phases. title: Photovoltaics - I already have a (power) grid connection. Why do I need to apply for a new grid access?
answer: Without a PV system, you exclusively draw power from the grid. This is regulated in your existing network access. With your PV system, you produce your own electricity and feed the portion that you do not consume into the grid. This is regulated with the new network access and you receive a separate meter point for feeding your surplus PV electricity into the grid.

title: Storage - How Exactly Does Credit Purchase Work?
answer: After completing your zholar order and passing the expert check, you will receive a link via email to finalize your financing directly with our financing partner, UniCredit Bank Austria. This can be done online, or if preferred, you can visit a bank branch. After successful completion of the financing, the bank will inform zholar and the order processing (application for network access, etc.) by zholar will begin. title: Unforeseen Costs: Renovations in the Electrical Distribution for PV Installation: Costs and Approval Required
answer: In fact, the law stipulates that when intervening in an existing electrical house system - as is the case with a PV installation - the house installation must be brought up to the current state of technology. Otherwise, the network operator will not release the PV system for operation. This is not a direct part of the zholar PV system, but a modification that is needed - regardless of who the PV system comes from. The zholar installation partner can carry out such modifications, but will certainly make a cost estimate before starting work and obtain your approval. Otherwise, you can also ask your house electrician to check the electrical distribution board before the PV installation and upgrade it if necessary.

title: Monitoring - How are the costs calculated for individual devices/device groups?
answer: In the BE.SpareFlo app, you can store your current electricity price. Based on this price, the costs for each device or device category are determined. You always have the option to update the electricity price in the menu. Please note that the cost calculation is based on the assumption that the electricity is 100% sourced from the grid. If you produce your own electricity, for example through your photovoltaic system, this is currently not offset in the app.

title: Balcony Power Plant - What Happens to the Generated but Unused Electricity?
answer: The unused electricity, i.e., the surplus, is fed into the power grid. You do not receive any compensation for this fed-in electricity from the electricity provider, but due to the integrated storage, this amount is low anyway and the focus is on the self-consumption of the generated solar power. This increases your electricity cost savings.

title: Photovoltaics - How much roof area do I need for a solar PV package?
answer: For zholarMax (approx. 3 kWp), about 16 m2 is required on a continuous roof side. For zholarMarry (approx. 5 kWp), about 26 m2 is required, for zholarMarry XL (approx. 8 kWp), about 42 m2 is required, and for zholarMarry XXL (approx. 10 kWp), about 52 m2 is required. title: Monitoring - How Does Live Electricity Consumption Monitoring Work?
answer: The live monitoring of power consumption works through the Energy Monitoring Sensor installed in the electrical distribution box. The sensor continuously measures the current power consumption in real time, distinguishing between different consumption levels such as standby, normal, and intensive. By continuously monitoring power consumption, you can track your energy use in real time to identify inefficient devices or behaviors and achieve targeted energy savings. The live monitoring data is captured by the Energy Monitoring Sensor and transferred to the BE Cloud platform. Within the BE Cloud platform, the data is analyzed using algorithms to provide a comprehensive overview of current energy consumption.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Is there still voltage at the plug after pulling the power cable?
answer: If you disconnect your SolMate from your household outlet, there will be no more voltage. The built-in inverters have integrated, certified safety precautions that ensure that voltage is only present when a power grid is detected. If no power grid is detected, the voltage at the plug is switched off in less than 200 milliseconds.

title: Storage - How Likely is a Blackout?
answer: The likelihood of a blackout in Austria is generally low, as the country has a stable power supply. However, unforeseen events such as extreme weather conditions or technical problems can lead to temporary power outages. Therefore, it is advisable to prepare for such contingencies, for example, by installing a blackout box as a backup power supply system.

title: I'm not sure if the system is economical, the economic profitability of a PV system and its importance for the climate change transition
answer: In general, there is hardly a more sensible installation than a photovoltaic (PV) system. Why? Because on one hand, it is crucial for the urgently needed climate change that we all make an effort, and on the other hand, because solar energy is now the cheapest form of energy. There is no cheaper energy supply than a sensibly sized PV system on your own roof. Depending on electricity prices, this can pay for itself in a few years - on average currently after 5-7 years; with the significantly higher electricity prices of last year, which could potentially return in some form this coming winter, even much faster. By directly consuming solar power, you reduce your grid consumption and save money, and by feeding the surplus not consumed

title: Monitoring - What is Special About the Energy Monitoring Sensor?
answer: The event-based energy monitoring sensor is easy to install as it does not require cables or batteries and is magnetically powered. Unlike time-based sensors, this one sends values based on events, leading to precise measurements with a max deviation of 5%. Additionally, our solution is cost-effective and user-friendly.

title: Monitoring - How Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Work?
answer: The sensor is installed directly in the electrical distribution box by the zholar installation partner and connected to the existing customer-side WiFi network. It then automatically transmits electrical measurements to the secure BE Cloud platform. After being installed in the fuse box and connected to the WiFi network, the sensor is activated in the BE.SpareFlo app and immediately and automatically begins collecting data on the electrical flows and transmits this data for analysis and evaluation directly to the cloud platform.

title: Monitoring - How Often Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Send the Collected Data to the Cloud?
answer: The Energy Monitoring Sensor operates on an event-based system, meaning it sends an event every time the RMS value of the current changes by more than 200 mA. The Energy Monitoring Sensor also sends time-based information to the BE-Cloud every minute.

title: Friends - What is the Zholar referral code and how long is it valid?
answer: The Zholar referral code is a combination of numbers starting with the prefix "EBL". It is linked to the email address used to place an order with Zholar. The referral code is valid as long as we offer the "Zholar Friends" referral program according to the terms and conditions in their current version. In addition to the referral code, a referral link is also created for you, which contains your referral code (e.g. https://zholar.de/planer/?aktionscode=EBL123456789). You can share this referral link directly with the people you want to recruit.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Does Grid Operation Work?

From our experience with 3,000 installed zholar systems, we know exactly what is important in PV planning and what information is needed. This information is requested during the ordering process and subsequently checked by our planning team. Thus, the planning of a PV system is greatly simplified for you. After the order, we quickly check the basic feasibility of the ordered PV system based on the provided photos & information.
